info.title: DevOps AI Toolkit REST API
info.description: REST API gateway for DevOps AI Toolkit MCP tools - provides HTTP access to all AI-powered DevOps automation capabilities

get.description: Opens a Server-Sent Events (SSE) stream for Model Context Protocol communication. This endpoint allows the server to push messages to the client without the client first sending data.

405.description: Method not allowed - server does not support SSE

post.description: Send a JSON-RPC message using Model Context Protocol. Used for tool calls, initialization, and other MCP operations. The server may respond with either a JSON object or open an SSE stream.

schema.description: Server-Sent Events stream with JSON-RPC messages

post.description: Manage the knowledge base: ingest documents, search with natural language, or delete chunks. Use "ingest" to store organizational documentation, "search" to find relevant content semantically, or "deleteByUri" to remove all chunks for a document. TIP: For complex questions, you can call search multiple times with different phrasings to gather comprehensive information before synthesizing your answer.

Unified tool for managing cluster data: organizational patterns, policy intents, and resource capabilities. For patterns and policies: supports create, list, get, delete, deleteAll, and search operations (patterns also support step-by-step creation workflow). For capabilities: supports scan, list, get, delete, deleteAll, and progress operations for cluster resource capability discovery and management. Use dataType parameter to specify what to manage: "pattern" for organizational patterns, "policy" for policy intents, "capabilities" for resource capabilities.

AI-powered Kubernetes application operations tool for Day 2 operations. Handles updates, scaling, enhancements, rollbacks, and deletions through natural language intents. Analyzes current state, applies organizational patterns and policies, validates changes via dry-run, and executes approved operations safely.

example.intent: deploy web application with PostgreSQL database
example.refinedIntent: deploy web application with PostgreSQL database

post.description: Setup project, audit repository, or generate repository files. Use this when user wants to: setup project, audit repo, check missing files, create README, add LICENSE, generate CONTRIBUTING.md, add CI/CD workflows, initialize documentation, setup governance files. Analyzes local repositories and generates missing configuration, documentation, and governance files. Does NOT handle Kubernetes deployments - use recommend for those.

Natural language query interface for Kubernetes cluster intelligence. Ask any questions about your cluster resources, capabilities, and status in plain English. Examples: "What databases are running?", "Describe the nginx deployment", "Show me pods in the kube-system namespace", "What operators are installed?", "Is my-postgres healthy?"

example.intent: deploy web application with PostgreSQL database

post.description: Deploy applications, infrastructure, and services using Kubernetes resources with AI recommendations. Supports cloud resources via operators like Crossplane, cluster management via CAPI, and traditional Kubernetes workloads. Describe what you want to deploy. Does NOT handle policy creation, organizational patterns, or resource capabilities - use manageOrgData for those.

example.intent: deploy web application with PostgreSQL database

post.description: AI-powered Kubernetes issue analysis that provides root cause identification and actionable remediation steps. Unlike basic kubectl commands, this tool performs multi-step investigation, correlates cluster data, and generates intelligent solutions. Use when users want to understand WHY something is broken, not just see raw status. Ideal for: troubleshooting failures, diagnosing performance issues, analyzing pod problems, investigating networking/storage issues, or any "what's wrong" questions.
Get comprehensive system health and diagnostics

McpJsonRpcRequest.description: JSON-RPC 2.0 request message for MCP protocol

operation.description: Operation to perform: "ingest" to add documents, "search" for semantic search, "deleteByUri" to remove all chunks for a document.

content.description: Document content to ingest (required for ingest operation).

uri.description: Full URL identifying the document (required for ingest and deleteByUri). E.g., https://github.com/org/repo/blob/main/docs/guide.md

metadata.description: Optional metadata to store with chunks

query.description: Natural language search query (required for search operation).

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return for search (default: 20).

uriFilter.description: Optional URL prefix to filter search results (e.g., "https://github.com/org/repo/").

dataType.description: Type of cluster data to manage: "pattern" for organizational patterns, "policy" for policy intents, "capabilities" for resource capabilities

operation.description: Operation to perform on the cluster data

sessionId.description: Session ID (required for continuing workflow steps, optional for progress - uses latest session if omitted)

step.description: Current workflow step (required when sessionId is provided)

response.description: User response to previous workflow step question

id.description: Data item ID (required for get/delete operations) or search query (required for search operations)

limit.description: Maximum number of items to return (default: 10)

resourceList.description: Comma-separated list of resources to scan (format: Kind.group or Kind for core resources). When provided without sessionId, triggers a fire-and-forget targeted scan.

mode.description: Scan mode: "full" triggers a fire-and-forget full cluster scan that returns immediately and scans all resources in the cluster. Mutually exclusive with resourceList.

collection.description: Collection name for capabilities operations (default: "capabilities", use "capabilities-policies" for pre-populated test data)

interaction_id.description: INTERNAL ONLY - Do not populate. Used for evaluation dataset generation.

intent.description: User intent for operation: "update X to Y", "scale Z", "make W HA", etc.

sessionId.description: Session ID from previous operate call

refinedIntent.description: Clarified intent if user wants to provide more details

interaction_id.description: INTERNAL ONLY - Do not populate. Used for evaluation dataset generation.

step.description: Workflow step: "discover" (default) starts new session and returns file list, "reportScan" analyzes scan results, "generateScope" generates all files in a scope. Defaults to "discover" if omitted.

sessionId.description: Session ID from previous step (required for reportScan and generateScope steps)

existingFiles.description: List of files that exist in the repository (required for first reportScan call, optional for subsequent calls with selectedScopes)

selectedScopes.description: Scopes user chose to setup (e.g., ["readme", "legal", "github-community"]) (required for reportScan step after initial scan)

scope.description: Scope to generate (e.g., "github-community") (required for generateScope step)

answers.description: Answers to ALL questions for the scope (required for generateScope step)

intent.description: Natural language query about the cluster

interaction_id.description: INTERNAL ONLY - Do not populate. Used for evaluation dataset generation.

stage.description: Deployment workflow stage: "recommend" (default), "chooseSolution", "answerQuestion:required", "answerQuestion:basic", "answerQuestion:advanced", "answerQuestion:open", "generateManifests", "deployManifests". Defaults to "recommend" if omitted.

intent.description: What the user wants to deploy, create, setup, install, or run on Kubernetes. Examples: "deploy web application", "create PostgreSQL database", "setup Redis cache", "install Prometheus monitoring", "configure Ingress controller", "provision storage volumes", "launch MongoDB operator", "run Node.js API", "setup CI/CD pipeline", "create load balancer", "install Grafana dashboard", "deploy React frontend"

final.description: Set to true to skip intent clarification and proceed directly with recommendations. If false or omitted, the tool will analyze the intent and provide clarification questions to help improve recommendation quality.

solutionId.description: Solution ID for chooseSolution, answerQuestion, generateManifests, and deployManifests stages

timeout.description: Deployment timeout in seconds for deployManifests stage

interaction_id.description: INTERNAL ONLY - Do not populate. Used for evaluation dataset generation.

issue.description: Issue description that needs to be analyzed and remediated

mode.description: Execution mode: manual requires user approval, automatic executes based on thresholds

confidenceThreshold.description: For automatic mode: minimum confidence required for execution (default: 0.8)

maxRiskLevel.description: For automatic mode: maximum risk level allowed for execution (default: low)

executeChoice.description: Execute a previously generated choice (1=Execute via MCP, 2=Execute via agent)

sessionId.description: Session ID from previous remediate call when executing a choice

executedCommands.description: Commands that were executed to remediate the issue

interaction_id.description: INTERNAL ONLY - Do not populate. Used for evaluation dataset generation.
INTERNAL ONLY - Do not populate. Used for evaluation dataset generation.

type.description: Parameter type (string, number, boolean, object, array)

count.description: Number of resources of this kind

kinds.description: List of resource kinds with counts

deletes.description: Resources to delete (requires namespace, name, kind, apiVersion)

isResync.description: When true, performs full reconciliation - deletes resources not in upserts list

count.description: Number of times this event has occurred

containerCount.description: Number of containers in the pod

arguments.description: Arguments to pass to the prompt

sourceIdentifier.description: The source identifier that was deleted

title.description: Document title if available from metadata

chunkIndex.description: Position of chunk within source document

query.description: The question to answer from the knowledge base

limit.description: Maximum chunks to retrieve per search (default: 20)

uriFilter.description: Optional: filter searches to specific document URI

collection.description: Collection name to migrate. If omitted, migrates all collections.
